page.title: 20CRINOIDS. LITTLE URSWICK.
page.content:
Crinoids,or sea lillies often beau- tifully coloured lived in colonies on the sea bed.We have lots of Crinoid fossils in our area.We have disc shaped columnals. There are other kinds of Crinoids like Plalycrintes some of them had stems others did'nt. STROPHOMENA- has fine ribs and rested at the bottom of the sea.We have fossils of these also.
The children involved in the compil- ation of these 20 pages are: Urswick Grammar School 9-11 year old pupils, and Aldingham Parochial School 7-9 year old pupils. Urswick: pages, 3, 4, 5, 11, 14, 16, 18 and 20. Aldingham: 1, 2, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, 12, 13, 15, 17 and 19.
